ZNC is an IRC bouncer that keeps you con.string:
ZNC is an IRC bouncer that keeps you connected 24/7. Features include:

- Always-on connection
- Message playback when you reconnect
- Multiple network support
- Automatic configuration

Primarily intended for DBase network. Use on other networks at your own risk.

Block DCC connections to private (RFC191.string: Block DCC connections to private (RFC1918) and localhost addresses. This prevents SSRF-like attacks where a malicious user could trick your client into connecting to internal network services.

Disabling this option allows DCC connect.string:
Disabling this option allows DCC connections to private network addresses (10.x.x.x, 192.168.x.x, 172.16-31.x.x, localhost). This could allow malicious users to make your device connect to internal network services. Only disable if you understand the risks and need to connect to a local IRC bouncer or similar service.

/ban -k spammer Stop spamming

/ban #channel spammer

AndroidIRCX includes convenience aliases.string: AndroidIRCX includes convenience aliases that expand into common NickServ/ChanServ commands. These depend on services availability on your network.

Examples:\n/nsid mypassword\n/nsreg mypa.string:
Examples:
/nsid mypassword
/nsreg mypassword user@example.com
/nsghost YourNick mypassword
/nsrecover YourNick mypassword

Examples:\n/csop #channel Nick\n/csdeop.string:
Examples:
/csop #channel Nick
/csdeop #channel Nick
/cvoice #channel Nick
/csdevoice #channel Nick
/csregister #channel password
/cspass #channel newpassword

Follow these simple steps to connect to.string: Follow these simple steps to connect to an IRC server:

1. Tap the dropdown (‚ñº) in the header.string: 1. Tap the dropdown (‚ñº) in the header

4. Save, then tap the network name to co.string: 4. Save, then tap the network name to connect

Nickname + Real Name: Required identity.string: Nickname + Real Name: Required identity fields

Save with the [Save] button in the heade.string: Save with the [Save] button in the header

In the Networks list, tap \"+ Add Server.string: In the Networks list, tap "+ Add Server" under your network:

Identity profiles are managed in Setting.string: Identity profiles are managed in Settings:

Select a network, then \"+ Add / Edit Id.string: Select a network, then "+ Add / Edit Identity"

End-to-End Encryption ensures that only.string: End-to-End Encryption ensures that only you and the recipient can read messages.\nEven the IRC server cannot decrypt them.

Encryption keys are automatically genera.string: Encryption keys are automatically generated when you install AndroidIRCX.

Wait for them to share their key.string: Wait for them to share their key

‚úÖ Verify key fingerprints out-of-band.string:
‚úÖ Verify key fingerprints out-of-band (phone call)
‚úÖ Rotate channel keys periodically
‚úÖ Only share keys with trusted users
‚úÖ Keep your device secure with PIN/biometric lock

‚ùå Don't share keys over unencrypted ch.string:
‚ùå Don't share keys over unencrypted channels
‚ùå Don't share keys publicly
‚ùå Don't ignore key verification warnings
‚ùå Don't leave encrypted channels unattended

The sender hasn't shared their encryptio.string: The sender hasn't shared their encryption key with you yet.

You joined the channel after messages we.string: You joined the channel after messages were sent, or key was rotated.

Solution: Check Settings ‚Üí Display & U.string: Solution: Check Settings ‚Üí Display & UI ‚Üí Show Encryption Indicators

View and manage your keys in:
Settings ‚Üí Security ‚Üí Manage Encryption Keys
